name: 2017_04_humanities_student_major_45_applyingtocollege
title: 2017-04-humanities-student-major_45_ApplyingToCollege.txt
content_scrubbed:
hey! i'm a current freshman at dartmouth so feel free to pm me if you have any further questions.

academics - i love how dartmouth has a small liberal_arts college feel. all of my classes so far have been taught by professors (versus TAs or grad students) with a small class size, except for some intro cs classes which were 80-100. it is definitely rigorous but imo there[.] grade inflation anyway, as most classes have a b+/a- median, but i imagine its the same as brown.

social life - lol if you ever did any research at all on dartmouth[.] social life you'd know a lot of it is centered on the greek system, which may or may not be your thing. but i will say that it is pretty open/chill (in my perspective as a female, though) and its definitely not all encompassing. there are tons of social spaces outside of it as well.

research/internships/jobs - i dont have a lot for you about this so far, but i will say that i keep getting emails these days about companies visiting campus and a lot of them are banks... maybe thats your thing. dartmouth also offers grants for research and internships at non-profits on your off terms so theyll support whatever you wanna do.

weather - well its snowing rn outside... i'm from california and even so i loved the winter (didnt think id be saying those words, ever); people have told me it was warmer than usual though.

and re: being low-income, several of my friends have expressed their discomfort at times because a good number of people are quite affluent ([just look at this](https://www. nytimes. com/interactive/2017/01/18/upshot/some-colleges-have-more-students-from-the-top-1-percent-than-the-bottom-60. html?_r=0)) but i imagine it would be similar at brown as well
